name: Meadowlark
text:
Fascinating to watch a small bird/ Fly down the slope of a meadow/ It pauses with wigs outstretched - middle of the air -/ Then retracts its feathers fast,/ Close to the body/ Picks up speed in a dive/ Its true weight revealed/ In gravityâ€™s jolt/ Before it stretches to glide again./

This pause and sprint spaces itself/ Out along the length of the hill/ A mesmeric undulation/ The ends at the top/ Of a noisy tree./
